h3. Issue Summary
For some reason, some *Content by Label* macros have the schema-version parameter set to 1, which causes an error and breaks the page. That parameter should be 4.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
So far, we haven't been able to replicate the issue from scratch, but we've received some reports of this issue.

h3. Expected Results
* It shouldn't be possible to have the macro with the wrong schema
* Or it shouldn't break the page

h3. Actual Results
The page can't be viewed, with the "We've hit a snag" error message:
 !image-2021-07-29-20-37-00-729.png|thumbnail! 
And the following error in the browser's console:
{code:none}Error: Failed to parse ADF: <div class="error fatal-render-error">Error: Error migrating macro 'contentbylabel' in content 'ContentId{id=12345}' from schema version 1. Message: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unable to migrate contentbylabel parameters
	at ...{code}

h3. Workaround
Update the page's source code using the API and change the following parameter inside the *contentbylabel* macro:
{code}ac:schema-version="1"{code}
set it to
{code}ac:schema-version="4"{code}

You may [contact support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact] and mention this bug report so we can apply the workaround for you.
fields.summary: Broken parameter on the Content By Label macro breaks the page

The page that contains the marked excerpt (in edit mode, new editor)

h3. Problem Definition

Jira Service Management Server and Data Center can integrate with Confluence Cloud or Server/DC. Within the Knowledge Base settings for Jira, there is an option to specify the number of search results returned when searching the KB. Setting this to a value higher than 3 will paginate the results.

*Expected:* With Jira Service Management Server/DC using Confluence Cloud as a knowledge base, selecting the next page of results will display subsequent results as if the user had searched that Confluence space directly on Confluence.

*Actual:* When Confluence Cloud is used as a KB, each page shows the same three results.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add support for pagination of search results for Jira Service Project Knowledge Bases to Confluence Cloud.

h3. Why this is important

KB search is important functionality that has better support in self-hosted products than in Cloud products. 
 
h3. Workaround 

There is no workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Add support for paginated search results when using Confluence as a Knowledge Base for a Jira Service Management Server or DC Service Project

fields.description:
Normally when viewing a page, if that page receives an update and the shown page is stale, a “New version published” flag is shown with the option to reload the content. However, if the page was edited by the viewer’s account, the stale content flag is *not* shown and the user may be viewing a stale page if they had multiple tabs/windows on the page.

The same behaviour is observed when an app calls an API with user impersonation, but now the problem is exaggerated because the app is triggering the update and consequently the user may be completely unaware of the change, or at least details of the change.

It is suggested that this policy of not notifying the user who made the change be reviewed with two potential solutions:
 * Notify the user even when they made the update; OR

Since this integration has a lag to update the events, to make the events appear immediately, there is a *Refresh* button from the calendar options. However, this button is not refreshing the events/Issues created from Jira.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a few issues in Jira that will have date values like the "Due Date" one.
 # In Team calendars, [create a new calendar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/create-add-and-edit-calendars-654213559.html] and select the *Jira Issue Dates* type.
 # Add a JQL, project, or a saved filter to reflect the created issues as indicated in the [article to add Jira events|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/add-jira-events/].
 # Confirm the dates to show and range from the event configurations and tap *Save*
 # Observe that the events are displayed based on the Jira information. Now, create a new issue with a due date that should make it to be displayed in the calendar.
 # As it will not be reflected immediately, go to the calendar configuration (ellipsis button at the right side of the calendar's name) and tap *Refresh*

h3. Expected Results

The new Jira events should be displayed.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens as if the "Refresh" functionality had no effect.

However, for this specific API, the users must have access to the pages so they can interact with its content.

Through the UI, admins can access these pages and change their restrictions with some options like the following:
 * Through the space permissions, access the [Restricted pages part|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/add-or-remove-page-restrictions/#AddorRemovePageRestrictions-Viewallrestrictedpagesinaspace] and remove the restrictions.
 * Use the [Admin key|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/bypass-access-restrictions-on-a-page-with-admin-key/] (Confluence Premium or Enterprise only) to bypass the restrictions to access the page and change them.

h3. Suggestion

Since the alternatives are available for the UI only, admins do not have any options to bypass such restrictions when using the API to help with bulk operations like the removal of restrictions.

This is a suggestion to allow the restrictions to be bypassed for the API while using the [Admin key feature|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/bypass-access-restrictions-on-a-page-with-admin-key/].

# On these pages, add the [Page properties macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-macro/] with a common column between them.
# In these columns, add a text and then, [insert a link to them|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-links-and-anchors/]. For example, each column with different texts pointing to home pages of spaces, which will only have the "space key" as a difference.
# Publish these pages and add a common label to them.
# On a specific page, add the [Page properties report macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-macro/] and configure it to display the specific column and specific label.
# Also on its configuration, add this column name on the *Sort By* field.

h3. Expected Results

The sorting should be based on the alphabetical order of the texts, like the sorting function when tapping the column name.

h3. Actual Results

The sorting will respect the content within the link to the page, ignoring the text used.

When using only text, the legacy editor pages will be displayed at the bottom.

h3. Workaround

Tap the column name while viewing the page so the sorting will be based on the text.
fields.summary: Sorting results respect the content of links instead of text in the Page Properties Report

h3. Issue Summary

When using the [Page properties report macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-macro/] and sorting the columns using the "Sort By" function, the order will change depending on the editor used for the source page(s) instead of the text/links added to it.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create multiple pages using both Legacy and the current/new editors.
 # On these pages, add the [Page properties macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-macro/] with a common column between them.
 # Add some text/links to the content of these columns.
 # Finally, publish these pages and add a common label to them.
 # On a specific page, add the [Page properties report macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-page-properties-macro/] and configure it to display the specific column and specific label.
 # Also on its configuration, add this column name on the *Sort By* field.

h3. Expected Results

The sorting should be based on the alphabetical order of the texts/links.
h3. Actual Results

The sorting changes depending on the editor used. For example, when using texts with links to other pages, the legacy editor pages might come first in the list. When using only text, the legacy editor pages will be displayed at the bottom.

h3. Workaround

* [Convert all the source pages to use the current editor|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/convert-pages-to-the-new-editor/];
* Tap the column name while viewing the page so the sorting will be based on the text, ignoring the editor used;
fields.summary: Sorting results change according to the source page's editor in the Page Properties Report
